notesStmt.note: Leaves missing after folio 79, 87, 100, 108. Defective at the end.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Prayers for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur, Ashkenazi rite (aka 'London Days of Awe Maḥzor').

msItem.title: Services for the first day of Rosh ha-Shanah
Services for the second day of Rosh ha-Shanah

collation.p: 19 quires: i8-1 (folios 1-7), ii8 (folios 8-15), iii6 (folios 16-21), iv-x8 (folios 22-77), xi8-1 (folios 78-84), xii6 (folios 85-90), xiii8 (folios 91-98), xiv8-1 (folios 99-105), xv6-1 (folios 106-110), xvi-xix8 (folios 111-142). There are catchwords at the end of the quires. The first leaf the first quire is missing.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script, partially punctuated. Ḥayim: the word ḥayim is decorated (e.g. folios 10r, 31r, 37v, 67r, 103v, 133r, 133v).

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r 1 initial-word panel inhabited by birds, dragons, and hybrids in ink.
28v2 initial words decorated with geometrical motifs/inhabited by hybrids and dragons in brown ink.
48v2 initial words decorated with geometrical motifs/inhabited by hybrids and dragons in brown ink.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Mahazor for New Year & Day of Atonement. German Rite. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional MS. 16,916.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased at a sale at Pattich's (?) 24 Apr. 1847, lot. 465 (folio [143v]).
